subject: Re: [junit] Re: (No results back from JUnit?) Success in firewall-free environment.
msgSnippet: ... I can tell you that JUnit is not the problem, then, because JUnit does absolutely nothing with ports or HTTP. Whatever the problem is, it s in your code,
messageBody:
amit wrote:

> As you suggested, I tried runnig the test by disabling the
> firewall. It worked in both text and graphical mode of junit. I got
> results with no errors and failures.
> Enabling the firewall caused same error and everythig was normal
> by disabling it. I could not get what the problem was.

I can tell you that JUnit is not the problem, then, because JUnit does
absolutely nothing with ports or HTTP. Whatever the problem is, it's in
your code, or something else it uses.

I don't know how helpful that is, but more information is usually better
than less. :)

> Anyways, Thanks a lot for your help.

You're welcome. Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
